text: Dyschoriste is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. Members of the genus are commonly known as snakeherb. ==Etymology== The name comes from the Greek δυσ, poorly, and χωριστός, to split, in reference to the slightly lobed stigma. ==Selected species== *Dyschoriste angusta (A.Gray) Small – Pineland snakeherb *Dyschoriste crenulata Kobuski – Wavyleaf snakeherb *Dyschoriste hondurensis Leonard *Dyschoriste decumbens (A.Gray) Kuntze – Spreading snakeherb *Dyschoriste hirsutissima (Nees) Kuntze – Swamp snakeherb *Dyschoriste humistrata (Michx.) Kuntze – Swamp snakeherb *Dyschoriste jaliscensis Kobuski *Dyschoriste linearis (Torr. & A.Gray) Kuntze – Narrowleaf snakeherb *Dyschoriste oaxacensis Kobuski *Dyschoriste oblongifolia (Michx.) Kuntze – Oblongleaf snakeherb *Dyschoriste rubiginosa Rama. & Wash. (D. angustifolia) *Dyschoriste xylopoda Kobuski ==References== ==External links== Category:Acanthaceae Category:Acanthaceae genera
title: Dyschoriste
